meanings.definition: Having branches or flower clusters that form a flat-topped or convex cluster.
meanings.sent1: The corymbose flowers on the tree created a beautiful cluster on top.
meanings.sent2: The garden displayed a lovely corymbose arrangement of flowers.
meanings.sent3: The corymbose tree looked like a colorful umbrella in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, styled in a corymbose manner, resembled a blooming garden.
meanings.sent5: The corymbose display of flowers was a sight to behold.

meanings.sent1: The artist painted a corymbose pattern on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The leaves were placed in a corymbose design around the vase.
meanings.sent3: The corymbose layout of the chairs made the room feel cozy.
meanings.sent4: Her dress had a corymbose style that caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The cupcakes were decorated in a delightful corymbose fashion.
